19.str2: To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.

19.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
From pas and a derivative of rheo; all out-spokenness, i.e. Frankness, bluntness, publicity; by implication, assurance.
To make known, declare, know, discover. From a derivative of ginosko; to make known; subjectively, to know.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a derivative of muo; a secret or 'mystery'.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From the same as euaggelizo; a good message, i.e. The gospel.

20.str2: Gen: in behalf of; acc: above.

20.parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Genitive Neuter Singular
Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
20.str2: To be aged, act as an ambassador. From the base of presbuteros; to be a senior, i.e. act as a representative.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
A (light) chain, bond. Of uncertain derivation; a fetter or manacle.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

20.parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Middle - 1st Person Singular
20.str2: To speak freely, boldly; To be confident.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.

20.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

20.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
20.str2: Third person singular active present of deo; also deon deh-on'; neuter active participle of the same; both used impersonally; it is Necessary.

21.str2: From a derivative of tugchano; fortuitous, i.e. Fortunate; Tychicus, a Christian.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From agapao; beloved.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
And, even, also, namely.
Trustworthy, faithful, believing. From peitho; objectively, trustworthy; subjectively, trustful.
Probably from an obsolete diako; an attendant, i.e. a waiter; specially, a Christian teacher and pastor.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

21.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

21.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
And, even, also, namely.

21.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

21.str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.

21.str2: To do, perform, accomplish; be in any condition, i.e. I fare; I exact, require.

22.str2: To send, transmit, permit to go, put forth.

In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
From agapao; love, i.e. Affection or benevolence; specially a love-feast.

Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.

Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
